title: Miuju 2024 : Maesil Liquor
description: Miuju is a fruit liqueur made with 2024 Goyang-grown plums. 'Miu' is the creator’s cat, and 'uju' reflects the endless inspiration she brings.

content.content: Miuju is not just a fruit liqueur — it is a personal archive of time, craftsmanship, and sentiment. Created by a developer and musician, this project began with an intention to capture emotion in a bottle.

In May 2024, fresh green plums were handpicked in Goyang, Korea. Each plum was carefully cleaned and dried to prevent bruising. The base was created using a 1:1:1 ratio of plums, sugar, and refined soju, then sealed in a sterilized glass jar.

The mixture was aged undisturbed for one full year in a dark, cool environment. This slow infusion process gently extracted the natural essence of the plums — yielding a deep, smooth profile without artificial intervention.

The bottle and label were designed to reflect the calm and intentional nature of the project. A limited run of bottles was custom-made at a local Korean glass workshop, and each label was designed and applied by hand by the creator.

The label features minimalist Korean typography and ink-inspired plum blossom motifs. It is printed on water-resistant material, and every bottle is individually labeled — one by one. The total production run remains under 100 bottles.

Miuju is estimated to contain around 34% alcohol by volume. Despite its high proof, it delivers a surprisingly smooth and gentle drinking experience. The initial notes are subtle — soft plum aroma with natural sweetness and a touch of acidity from long-term aging.
It’s a liquor that doesn’t taste like liquor. Light on the tongue, but warm on the mind.
